description.narrative: In this project, CyArk Foundation is teaming up with local organizations and institutions in Ecuador and Peru to produce web-based interactive 3D experiences of the ancient Incan archaeological sites of Ingapirca and Pumapungo in Ecuador and the Aypate Archaeological Complex in Peru. The datasets created during the project will serve as a comprehensive moment-in-time inventory of the sites, as well as a canvas for storytelling and interactive 3D experiences.

title.narrative: Improving multisector response to TIP cases in Ecuador

description.narrative: To conduct a multi-pronged project that focuses on improving the legal framework and policies related to human trafficking through drafting human trafficking-focused legislation that is aligned with international standards. The OAS also will work with the Government of Ecuador to strengthen human trafficking frameworks that do not require legislature approval, such as guidelines and standardized protocols. The OAS will review the existing operating framework of law enforcement agents and justice operators, to ensure compatibility with the proposed new legislation and good practices. This will culminate in the elaboration of a toolkit for various stakeholders with guidelines and standardized protocols on investigation, prosecution, identification, and referral.
